alert.note: Alert for Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 2:01PM AKST until November 18 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow expected. Periods of low visibility in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 3 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Driving and walking surfaces will become very slippery as ice forms on the ground. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could cause large snow drifts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and freezing rain is expected to develop this afternoon, then change to all snow on Friday. Low visibility in blowing snow is expected late tonight into Friday. Snow will taper off Friday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
